did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Gail and Stephen Rudin collection of American history miscellany, [circa 1776-1933].
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Documents related to various events in Unites States history. Includes items related to the Revolutionary War and the War of 1812, a Washington, D.C. lottery ticket, and prescriptions for alcohol written during Prohibition.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Documents related to various events in Unites States history. Includes items related to the Revolutionary War and the War of 1812, a Washington, D.C. lottery ticket, and prescriptions for alcohol written during Prohibition.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Gail and Stephen Rudin collection of American history miscellany, #6995. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Forms part of the Eastern Wine and Grape Archive. (EWGA)

scopecontent.p:
Bounty for 74 Pounds for enlisting in The Continental Army.
Rudin # M-43

Soldier John Demmon enlists in the Continental Army, CT.
Rudin # M-58

Ticket 59 m 664 Class the Fourth for the U.S. Lottery to help finance the American Revolutionary War. Signed by J. Bullock.
Rudin # M-79

did.unittitle: Ticket 28 m 820 Class the First for the U.S. Lottery to help finance the American Revolutionary War. Signed by J. Searle.

scopecontent.p:
Paper shortages necessitated use of patterned wallpaper for some military documents. Enlistment of John Coffman. Maryland.
Rudin # M-99

Printed broadside announcing the bill (H.R. 91) proposing that the Star Spangled Banner be declared the National Anthem.
Rudin # M-96

Prohibition prescription for "one pint Rye Whiskey" for James Kelley. Accompanied by a second prescription for Whiskey for James Denby, this being a duplicate to be retained by the druggist.
Rudin # M-89

Washington City Canal Lottery for cutting the canal through the city of Washington to the Eastern Branch Harbour. One ticket signed by Notley Young and one signed by Daniel Carroll.
Rudin # M-81

Hagerstown, Agricultural Almanac, Hagerstown
Rudin # M-105

Group of five Confederate hand-made adversity envelopes made from a variety of paper products including bank and legal documents, bill of lading documents, and advertising broadsides. Postally used.
Rudin # M-86

This Congressional Report fixes the ultimate design and evolution of the American Flag as we know it today.
Rudin # M-94A

First magazine printing of the poem that became the National Anthem. (From "The Analectic Magazine" - Nov. 1814).
Rudin # M-95

Oath of Allegiance to State of New York and renouncing of allegiance to King of Great Britain. Signed by more than 50 local New York patriots.
Rudin # M-102

did.unittitle: Descriptive list of 26 deserters from Malone, New York
